title: Mamdani’s Success Spotlights a Deepening Rupture Among U.S. Jews
summary: While Zohran Mamdani won over some Jewish supporters, other Jewish Democrats suggested that concerns about their community’s safety are being dismissed in a movement and a city they helped build.

title: As Donors Work Against Mamdani, Top Democrats Stop Short of Backing Him
summary: After Zohran Mamdani’s performance in the New York City mayoral primary, Republicans and suburban Democrats attacked him, and party leaders seemed to be hedging their bets.

title: Young Muslim Voters in NYC Loved Zohran Mamdani. Their Parents Listened.
summary: Many Muslim Americans in New York City were impressed by Mr. Mamdani’s campaign and thrilled at being able to see themselves reflected in a mayoral candidate.

title: In New Assessment, C.I.A. Chief Says U.S. Strikes ‘Severely Damaged’ Iranian Program
summary: The administration suggested an initial report of less-severe damage was already outdated as the president continued to defend his assertion that key facilities had been “obliterated,” though no intelligence official has yet directly echoed his view.

title: Where Is Iran’s Supreme Leader, Ayatollah Ali Khamenei?
summary: Ayatollah Ali Khamenei has not been seen publicly or heard from in nearly a week. That absence has surprised and unnerved everyone from political insiders to the general public.

title: Iran’s Attack on a U.S. Base in Qatar Is a Nightmare Come True for Gulf States
summary: The countries have long worried about being sucked into regional war as they juggle relations with Washington, their security guarantor, while seeking to improve ties with Tehran.

title: How Trump’s Strike on Iran Might Affect China’s Calculus on Taiwan
summary: By attacking Iran, President Trump has shown he is willing to engage in a distant war. This raises questions in Beijing about what he might risk for Taiwan.

title: RFK Jr.’s Handpicked Vaccine Advisers Are Set to Meet for the First Time
summary: The reconstituted C.D.C. panel will revisit the standard vaccination schedule. The former head of an anti-vaccine group is now a special federal employee.

title: Emil Bove Denies Suggesting Justice Dept. Ignore Court Orders in Deportation Cases
summary: During a confirmation hearing for an appeals court opening, Emil Bove III was repeatedly questioned about a whistle-blower complaint that portrayed political appointees as willing to mislead judges.

title: Trump Urges Congress to ‘Kill’ Voice of America as Its Leader Defends Gutting It
summary: In a heated hearing, Kari Lake, the Trump ally in charge of the federally funded international broadcasting network, called the media agency “a rotten piece of fish” that should be defunded.

title: Usha Vance’s New Life in Trump’s Washington
summary: Old friends are bewildered by the turn taken by the second lady, a onetime Democrat and former litigator for a San Francisco firm. Others say she’s happy in the role.

title: In a Win for Trump, NATO Agrees to a Big Increase in Military Spending
summary: President Trump has long pushed the European allies to be more self-sufficient on defense, relying less on American protection. NATO committed to a major increase over the next decade.

title: They Had Come to Graduate. Their Minds Were on a Student Held by ICE.
summary: Dylan Lopez Contreras was arrested by immigration authorities. This week, he was remembered during the commencement for a school devoted to immigrants.

title: Trump Administration Sues Maryland Federal Judges Over Immigration Rule
summary: Lawyers for the administration said that a rule issued by a judge in Maryland intruded on the White House’s inherent powers to “enforce the nation’s immigration laws.”

title: This Vermont Soccer Team Plays for the Planet
summary: The Vermont Green Football Club champions environmental work and draws sold-out crowds, with the help of free ice cream.

title: American Airlines Passenger Recounts ‘Tense’ Landing After Engine Sparks
summary: The American Airlines flight with 153 passengers, which was headed to Charlotte, N.C., returned to Las Vegas shortly after takeoff. No one was injured.

title: Did Baby Talk Give Rise to Language?
summary: The way that human adults talk to young children is unique among primates, a new study found. That might be one secret to our species’ grasp of language.

title: The Ayatollah Has a Plan
summary: Iran’s supreme leader believes the country can outlast the West in a war of attrition.

title: ‘The U.S. Cannot Solve All the World’s Problems’
summary: We can’t fix everything. But if it’s cheap and easy to save lives, why wouldn’t we?

title: Soaring Temperatures in N.Y.C. Land More Than 100 in Emergency Rooms
summary: Not since 2019 have so many New Yorkers in a single day sought emergency medical attention for heat-related illnesses.

title: 17-Year-Old Fatally Shot in the Bronx After Fight Over a Water Gun
summary: Darrell Harris, a high school student, died after an encounter with men who were having a water gun fight at a local park, an official with knowledge of the incident said.

title: U.S. Accuses Three Mexican Financial Firms of Aiding Fentanyl Trade
summary: The U.S. Treasury found ties between drug cartels and the Mexican companies, including a brokerage firm controlled by a former chief of staff of Andrés Manuel López Obrador.

title: At Least 8 Killed as Protesters Battle Police in Kenya
summary: Demonstrators joined antigovernment marches across the country a year after huge rallies against a contentious tax plan left more than 60 people dead.
